item.title: By: Atin Gupta
item.dc:creator: Atin Gupta
item.content:encoded:
Please join the below LinkedIn group.

This group is unique in the sense that it put up XPages Objective questions and we can ask questions and discuss on those question.

http://www.linkedin.com/groups/Online-Xpages-Training-3920928

item.title: By: Rob
item.dc:creator: Rob
item.description: <p>I posted a comment about the blog names over on http://xpagesblog.com/ too. It looks like you're both using the same blog template except the <i>xpagesblog</i> doesn't remember my author data so I'll have to type it in every time.</p>
item.content:encoded: I posted a comment about the blog names over on http://xpagesblog.com/ too. It looks like you’re both using the same blog template except the xpagesblog doesn’t remember my author data so I’ll have to type it in every time.

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@Rob - Thanks for the heads up. I'm still settling in here and am ironing out kinks. Hopefully it is better now?</p>
item.content:encoded: @Rob – Thanks for the heads up. I’m still settling in here and am ironing out kinks. Hopefully it is better now?

item.title: By: Rob
item.dc:creator: Rob
item.description: <p>By the way, when I subscribe to your blog and the new XPages blog they are both named "Blog" in GoogleReader. Not the best branding plan I've seen :)</p>
item.content:encoded: By the way, when I subscribe to your blog and the new XPages blog they are both named "Blog" in GoogleReader. Not the best branding plan I’ve seen ðŸ™‚
